title: 111_hr2302
content: The "Military Retired Pay Fairness Act of 2009" limits recoupment of separation pay, special separation benefits, and voluntary separation incentive from members receiving retired or retainer pay. The "Military Retired Pay Fairness Act of 2009" limits recoupment of separation pay and special separation benefits from retired or retainer pay by specifying monthly installment schedules to avoid financial hardship on the member and dependents, with a maximum deduction of 25 percent. The Secretary of Defense consults with members on repayment rates for deductions from retired or retainer pay, considering financial ability and avoiding undue hardship. Deductions cannot start until 90 days after notification, with clear information provided on amounts and installment periods. The Secretary of Defense may waive deductions from retired or retainer pay if it causes financial hardship for the member. Additionally, the voluntary separation incentive payment schedule will be determined based on the member's financial ability to pay and to avoid undue financial hardship. The amount deducted from a member's retired or retainer pay cannot exceed 25 percent unless the member consents to a higher rate. The Secretary of Defense or Homeland Security will consult with the member to determine a repayment rate that considers their financial ability to pay and avoids causing undue hardship. Deductions from retired or retainer pay can be waived by the Secretary of Defense in cases of financial hardship. The deduction of amounts from a member's retired or retainer pay can be waived by the Secretary of Defense or Homeland Security if it would cause financial hardship. Notification of deductions must be given 90 days in advance, providing clear information on the amount and installment period. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act. They apply to deductions from retired or retainer pay of uniformed services members for that month and onwards.
